c74object.name: cage.sdif.markers.toroll
c74object.digest: Import a markers SDIF analysis into a bach.roll
c74object.description: Imports and displays a markers SDIF analysis into a bach.roll object.

inlet.description: The SDIF analysis containing markers information, as the one output by bach.readsdif.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the information imported from the most recently input analysis llll.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in first inlet is expected to contain the llll form of a marker SDIF analysis (as the one output by bach.readsdif). The bach.roll markers header specification is then output from the outlet. Such outlet must be connected to a bach.roll's first inlet in order to import marker information inside bach.roll.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: stream
attribute.description: An integer sets the ID of the stream from which the marker information should be imported. Use the all symbol, instead of an integer number, in order to take the marker information from all existing streams.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: SDIF analysis as llll. The SDIF analysis containing markers information, as the one output by bach.readsdif.
